    • Method Detail

      • startEvent

        public void startEvent()
        Description copied from class: BaseDataEvent
        Start the data event. The principle is that before this method is called by the user, the listeners should never get any data update; and after it is called and when some condition is met, the listeners must get updated.
        Specified by:
        startEvent in class BaseDataEvent

      • stopEvent

        public void stopEvent()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: BaseDataEvent
        After calling this method, the event should finish the current notification task after which no more notifications should be made.
        Specified by:
        stopEvent in class BaseDataEvent
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Called when sensor values have changed.

        See SensorManager for details on possible sensor types.

        See also SensorEvent.

        NOTE: The application doesn't own the event object passed as a parameter and therefore cannot hold on to it. The object may be part of an internal pool and may be reused by the framework.

        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - the SensorEvent.

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Sensor sensor,
                              int accuracy)
        Description copied from interface: android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Called when the accuracy of a sensor has changed.

        See SensorManager for details.

        Specified by:
        onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        accuracy - The new accuracy of this sensor

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: java.lang.Runnable
        Starts executing the active part of the class' code. This method is called when a thread is started that has been created with a class which implements Runnable.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
